channel.title: Brennan Gebotys
channel.description: Machine Learning, Statistics, and All Things Cool

item.title: Video TFRecords: How to Efficiently Load Video Data
item.description: Compared to images, loading video data is expensive due to the I/O bottleneck and increased decoding time. This reduces efficiency leading to significantly longer training times. Reading online, there are generally two solutions for data loading videos:

item.title: Generative Models: Recursive Edition
item.description: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) have shown great results in computer vision but how do they perform when applied to time-series data? Following this, do Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) or do Recursive Neural Networks (RNNs) achieve the best results?

item.title: Convex Optimization: Algorithms and their Rate of Convergence
Encapsulating Capsule Networks: Everything You Need To Know
item.description: When applying Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) (LeCun et al., 1990) to a computer vision task, a change in viewpoint (change in orientation, position, shear, etc.) is likely to lead to drastically different network activations, hindering the modelâ€™s ability to generalize. To solve this problem, current CNNs require a large number of parameters, datasets and computational power.

item.title: Going with the Flow: An Introduction to Normalizing Flows
